intro: Cota thirkei, commonly known as the thirkei cota, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Cota thirkei is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant colors and drought tolerance.
